intro: Microchirita minor, commonly known as the small microchirita, is a small, flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
